alert.note: Alert for Dane; Iowa (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 03 at 9:08AM CDT by NWS Milwaukee
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Iowa and western Dane Counties through 945 AM CDT... At 908 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 9 miles east of Dodgeville, moving southeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Barneveld and Hollandale. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
